enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

enumeratedValues.name: UNMASKED

enumeratedValues.name: MASKED
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

enumeratedValues.name: UNMASKED
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

enumeratedValues.name: MASKED
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

enumeratedValues.name: UMASKED

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Reception immediately stops and transmission stops after a bad CRC is appended to any currently transmitted frame.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: MAC is enabled, and reception and transmission are possible.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Magic detection logic disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The MAC core detects magic packets and asserts EIR[WAKEUP] when a frame is detected.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Normal operating mode.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Sleep mode.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Legacy FEC buffer descriptors and functions enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enhanced frame time-stamping functions enabled. Has no effect within the MAC besides controlling the DMA control bit ena_1588.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: MAC continues operation in debug mode.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: MAC enters hardware freeze mode when the processor is in debug mode.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The buffer descriptor bytes are not swapped to support big-endian devices.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The buffer descriptor bytes are swapped to support little-endian devices.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Preamble enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Preamble (32 ones) is not prepended to the MII management frame.

enumeratedValues.name: VAL_1
enumeratedValues.description: 1 internal module clock cycle

enumeratedValues.name: VAL2
enumeratedValues.description: 2 internal module clock cycles

enumeratedValues.name: VAL3
enumeratedValues.description: 3 internal module clock cycles

enumeratedValues.name: VAL8
enumeratedValues.description: 8 internal module clock cycles

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: See note above.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: All statistics counters are reset to 0.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The MIB block is updating MIB counters.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The MIB block is not currently updating any MIB counters.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: MIB logic is enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: MIB logic is disabled. The MIB logic halts and does not update any MIB counters.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Loopback disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Transmitted frames are looped back internal to the device and transmit MII output signals are not asserted. DRT must be cleared.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Receive path operates independently of transmit (i.e., full-duplex mode). Can also be used to monitor transmit activity in half-duplex mode.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Disable reception of frames while transmitting. (Normally used for half-duplex mode.)

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: MII or RMII mode, as indicated by the RMII_MODE field.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Will not reject frames as described above

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Will reject frames as described above

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable flow control

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enable flow control

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: MAC configured for MII mode.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: MAC configured for RMII operation.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: 100-Mbit/s operation.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: 10-Mbit/s operation.

fields.name: PADEN
fields.description: Enable Frame Padding Remove On Receive

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: No padding is removed on receive by the MAC.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Padding is removed from received frames.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Pause frames are terminated and discarded in the MAC.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Pause frames are forwarded to the user application.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The CRC field of received frames is transmitted to the user application.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The CRC field is stripped from the frame.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are accepted and forwarded to the client interface.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are silently discarded.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The payload length check is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The core checks the frame's payload length with the frame length/type field. Errors are indicated in the EIR[PLR] field.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Receive not stopped

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Receive stopped

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable graceful transmit stop

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enable graceful transmit stop

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable full-duplex

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enable full-duplex

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: No PAUSE frame transmitted.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The MAC stops transmission of data frames after the current transmission is complete.

fields.name: ADDSEL
fields.description: Source MAC Address Select On Transmit

enumeratedValues.name: VAL_MAC
enumeratedValues.description: Node MAC address programmed on PADDR1/2 registers.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The source MAC address is not modified by the MAC.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The MAC overwrites the source MAC address with the programmed MAC address according to ADDSEL.

fields.name: CRCFWD
fields.description: Forward Frame From Application With CRC

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: TxBD[TC] controls whether the frame has a CRC from the application.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The transmitter does not append any CRC to transmitted frames, as it is expecting a frame with CRC from the application.

fields.name: PADDR2
fields.description: Bytes 4 (bits 31:24) and 5 (bits 23:16) of the 6-byte individual address used for exact match, and the source address field in PAUSE frames

fields.name: ICCS
fields.description: Interrupt Coalescing Timer Clock Source Select

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Use MII/GMII TX clocks.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Use ENET system clock.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable Interrupt coalescing.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enable Interrupt coalescing.

fields.name: ICCS
fields.description: Interrupt Coalescing Timer Clock Source Select

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Use MII/GMII TX clocks.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Use ENET system clock.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable Interrupt coalescing.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enable Interrupt coalescing.

fields.name: IADDR1
fields.description: Contains the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address

fields.name: IADDR2
fields.description: Contains the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address

fields.name: GADDR1
fields.description: Contains the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address

fields.name: GADDR2
fields.description: Contains the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address

enumeratedValues.name: VAL64_0
enumeratedValues.description: 64 bytes written.

enumeratedValues.name: VAL64_1
enumeratedValues.description: 64 bytes written.

enumeratedValues.name: VAL128
enumeratedValues.description: 128 bytes written.

enumeratedValues.name: VAL192
enumeratedValues.description: 192 bytes written.

enumeratedValues.name: VAL1984
enumeratedValues.description: 1984 bytes written.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Reset. The transmission start threshold is programmed in TFWR[TFWR].

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enabled.

fields.name: R_DES_START
fields.description: Pointer to the beginning of the receive buffer descriptor queue.

registers.name: TDSR
registers.description: Transmit Buffer Descriptor Ring 0 Start Register

fields.name: X_DES_START
fields.description: Pointer to the beginning of the transmit buffer descriptor queue.

registers.name: MRBR
registers.description: Maximum Receive Buffer Size Register - Ring 0

fields.name: RX_SECTION_FULL
fields.description: Value Of Receive FIFO Section Full Threshold

fields.name: RX_SECTION_EMPTY
fields.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Section Empty Threshold

fields.name: STAT_SECTION_EMPTY
fields.description: RX Status FIFO Section Empty Threshold

fields.name: RX_ALMOST_EMPTY
fields.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

fields.name: RX_ALMOST_FULL
fields.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Full Threshold

fields.name: TX_SECTION_EMPTY
fields.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Section Empty Threshold

fields.name: TX_ALMOST_EMPTY
fields.description: Value of Transmit FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

fields.name: TX_ALMOST_FULL
fields.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Almost Full Threshold

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Indicates to the transmit data FIFO that the written frames contain two additional octets before the frame data. This means the actual frame begins at bit 16 of the first word written into the FIFO. This function allows putting the frame payload on a 32-bit boundary in memory, as the 14-byte Ethernet header is extended to a 16-byte header.

fields.name: IPCHK
fields.description: Enables insertion of IP header checksum.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Checksum is not inserted.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: If an IP frame is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically. The IP header checksum field must be cleared. If a non-IP frame is transmitted the frame is not modified.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Checksum not inserted.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: If an IP frame with a known protocol is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically into the frame. The checksum field must be cleared. The other frames are not modified.

fields.name: PADREM
fields.description: Enable Padding Removal For Short IP Frames

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Padding not removed.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Any bytes following the IP payload section of the frame are removed from the frame.

fields.name: IPDIS
fields.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong IPv4 Header Checksum

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Frames with wrong IPv4 header checksum are not discarded.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: If an IPv4 frame is received with a mismatching header checksum, the frame is discarded. IPv6 has no header checksum and is not affected by this setting. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared).

fields.name: PRODIS
fields.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong Protocol Checksum

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Frames with wrong checksum are not discarded.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: If a TCP/IP, UDP/IP, or ICMP/IP frame is received that has a wrong TCP, UDP, or ICMP checksum, the frame is discarded. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared).

fields.name: LINEDIS
fields.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With MAC Layer Errors

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Frames with errors are not discarded.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Any frame received with a CRC, length, or PHY error is automatically discarded and not forwarded to the user application interface.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Instructs the MAC to write two additional bytes in front of each frame received into the RX FIFO.

registers.name: RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN
registers.description: Tx Packets with CRC/Align Error Statistic Register

fields.name: TXPKTS
fields.description: Number of packets with CRC/align error

registers.name: RMON_T_UNDERSIZE
registers.description: Tx Packets Less Than Bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: TXPKTS
fields.description: Number of transmit packets less than 64 bytes with good CRC

registers.name: RMON_T_OVERSIZE
registers.description: Tx Packets GT MAX_FL bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: TXPKTS
fields.description: Number of transmit packets greater than MAX_FL bytes with good CRC

registers.name: RMON_T_FRAG
registers.description: Tx Packets Less Than 64 Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: TXPKTS
fields.description: Number of packets less than 64 bytes with bad CRC

registers.name: RMON_T_JAB
registers.description: Tx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: TXPKTS
fields.description: Number of transmit packets greater than MAX_FL bytes and bad CRC

registers.name: RMON_T_P_GTE2048
registers.description: Tx Packets Greater Than 2048 Bytes Statistic Register

fields.name: TXPKTS
fields.description: Number of transmit packets greater than 2048 bytes

registers.name: IEEE_T_1COL
registers.description: Frames Transmitted with Single Collision Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames transmitted with one collision

registers.name: IEEE_T_MCOL
registers.description: Frames Transmitted with Multiple Collisions Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames transmitted with multiple collisions

registers.name: IEEE_T_DEF
registers.description: Frames Transmitted after Deferral Delay Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames transmitted with deferral delay

registers.name: IEEE_T_LCOL
registers.description: Frames Transmitted with Late Collision Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames transmitted with late collision

registers.name: IEEE_T_EXCOL
registers.description: Frames Transmitted with Excessive Collisions Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames transmitted with excessive collisions

registers.name: IEEE_T_MACERR
registers.description: Frames Transmitted with Tx FIFO Underrun Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames transmitted with transmit FIFO underrun

registers.name: IEEE_T_CSERR
registers.description: Frames Transmitted with Carrier Sense Error Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames transmitted with carrier sense error

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: This read-only field is reserved and always has the value 0

registers.name: IEEE_T_FDXFC
registers.description: Flow Control Pause Frames Transmitted Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of flow-control pause frames transmitted

registers.name: IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK
registers.description: Octet Count for Frames Transmitted w/o Error Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Octet count for frames transmitted without error Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields).

registers.name: RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN
registers.description: Rx Packets with CRC/Align Error Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of receive packets with CRC or align error

registers.name: RMON_R_UNDERSIZE
registers.description: Rx Packets with Less Than 64 Bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of receive packets with less than 64 bytes and good CRC

registers.name: RMON_R_OVERSIZE
registers.description: Rx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL and Good CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of receive packets greater than MAX_FL and good CRC

registers.name: RMON_R_FRAG
registers.description: Rx Packets Less Than 64 Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of receive packets with less than 64 bytes and bad CRC

registers.name: RMON_R_JAB
registers.description: Rx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of receive packets greater than MAX_FL and bad CRC

registers.name: RMON_R_P_GTE2048
registers.description: Rx Packets Greater than 2048 Bytes Statistic Register

registers.name: IEEE_R_DROP
registers.description: Frames not Counted Correctly Statistic Register

registers.name: IEEE_R_CRC
registers.description: Frames Received with CRC Error Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames received with CRC error

registers.name: IEEE_R_ALIGN
registers.description: Frames Received with Alignment Error Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of frames received with alignment error

registers.name: IEEE_R_MACERR
registers.description: Receive FIFO Overflow Count Statistic Register

registers.name: IEEE_R_FDXFC
registers.description: Flow Control Pause Frames Received Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of flow-control pause frames received

registers.name: IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK
registers.description: Octet Count for Frames Received without Error Statistic Register

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Number of octets for frames received without error

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The timer stops at the current value.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The timer starts incrementing.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The timer can be reset to zero when the given offset time is reached (offset event). The field is cleared when the offset event is reached, so no further event occurs until the field is set again. The timer offset value must be set before setting this field.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The timer is not affected and no action occurs, besides clearing OFFEN, when the offset is reached.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: If OFFEN is set, the timer resets to zero when the offset setting is reached. The offset event does not cause a timer interrupt.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: A period event interrupt can be generated (EIR[TS_TIMER]) and the event signal output is asserted when the timer wraps around according to the periodic setting ATPER. The timer period value must be set before setting this bit. Not all devices contain the event signal output. See the chip configuration details.

fields.name: PINPER
fields.description: Enables event signal output external pin frc_evt_period assertion on period event

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Disable.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Enable.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: No effect.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The current time is captured and can be read from the ATVR register.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: The timer is active and all configuration fields in this register are relevant.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: The internal timer is disabled and the externally provided timer value is used. All other fields, except CAPTURE, in this register have no effect. CAPTURE can still be used to capture the current timer value.

fields.name: OFFSET
fields.description: Offset value for one-shot event generation

fields.name: INC
fields.description: Clock Period Of The Timestamping Clock (ts_clk) In Nanoseconds

fields.name: TIMESTAMP
fields.description: Timestamp of the last frame transmitted by the core that had TxBD[TS] set the ff_tx_ts_frm signal asserted from the user application

fields.name: TF0
fields.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 0

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 0 is clear

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 0 is set

fields.name: TF1
fields.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 1

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 1 is clear

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 1 is set

fields.name: TF2
fields.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 2

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 2 is clear

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 2 is set

fields.name: TF3
fields.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 3

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 3 is clear

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Flag for Channel 3 is set

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: DMA request is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: DMA request is enabled

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_DIS
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_RE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on rising edge.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_FE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on falling edge.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_BE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on both edges.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - software only.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_TOGGLE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - toggle output on compare.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_CLR
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_SET_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_CLR_SET1
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare, clear output on overflow.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_CLR_SET
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare, set output on overflow.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_OUT_CMP_LOW
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output low on compare for 1 to 32 1588-clock cycles as specified by TPWC.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_OUT_CMP_HIGH
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output high on compare for 1 to 32 1588-clock cycles as specified by TPWC.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Interrupt is enabled

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has not occurred.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has occurred.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW1
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is one 1588-clock cycle.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW2
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is two 1588-clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW3
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is three 1588-clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW4
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is four 1588-clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW32
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is 32 1588-clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: DMA request is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: DMA request is enabled

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_DIS
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_RE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on rising edge.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_FE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on falling edge.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_BE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on both edges.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - software only.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_TOGGLE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - toggle output on compare.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_CLR
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_SET_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_CLR_SET1
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare, clear output on overflow.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_CLR_SET
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare, set output on overflow.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_OUT_CMP_LOW
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output low on compare for 1 to 32 1588-clock cycles as specified by TPWC.

enumeratedValues.name: TMR_OUT_CMP_HIGH
enumeratedValues.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output high on compare for 1 to 32 1588-clock cycles as specified by TPWC.

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Interrupt is enabled

enumeratedValues.name: ZERO
enumeratedValues.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has not occurred.

enumeratedValues.name: ONE
enumeratedValues.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has occurred.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW1
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is one 1588-clock cycle.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW2
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is two 1588-clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW3
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is three 1588-clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW4
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is four 1588-clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: VALW32
enumeratedValues.description: Pulse width is 32 1588-clock cycles.
